I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing getaway, and I look forward to returning soon.

Even the staff at the front desk made it unclear whether they purposely ignored my request because I booked through a third party, or if it was for some other reason. When I asked about it, the staff mentioned that the discount is now given as points instead. But what confused me was that the staff didn‚Äôt even ask for my membership number‚Äîprobably because I booked through a third party again. If Marriott is changing its policies, they should at least be transparent about it instead of making customers figure it out on their own. That being said, I do appreciate that the staff and cleaners at Marriott Harbour Bay were very friendly. Thank you to them for their hard work. However, the overall experience was frustrating, and Marriott‚Äôs service policies seem to be getting worse. Marriott used to prioritize loyal customers, but now it feels like they don‚Äôt care as much. This experience has made me rethink my loyalty to the brand.

Had an absolutely amazing stay here at the Marriott Batam. Even though it opened back in October 2020, it feels like it has only been operating for a couple of months with the whole of the facilities being in impeccable shape. The staff definitely take care of the facility and every bit of the hotel. Check-in process was very smooth especially if you‚Äôre arriving at the Harbour Bay Ferry Terminal. After exiting immigration and exiting the ferry station, you will find yourself literally steps away from the entrance of the Marriott Hotel, which is convenient (and quite a relief) especially for those that may be coming from the airport to the ferry to the hotel or are looking to relax as soon as possible. We were warmly greeted by the check-in staff at the second level. And after they checked their system, they recognized my status and had me check-in at the M Lounge on the 11th floor. I was greeted by Rena who completed the check-in process for us. She gave us all the details of the facility and walked us through the lounge and was such a pleasant joy and made our stay very enjoyable. If you have an opportunity to access the M Lounge, it is well staffed and a very comfortable place to have a coffee, grab a snack, enjoy local cuisine, and have fun unique drinks made by the staff themselves. I had an extra day of work on the first day there and it was a great place to work at, since the staff were accommodating, offered tea and coffee, and even offered the meeting room for me to take some personal calls. The gym was just the right size, and has most general equipment that should satisfy most people. It has a great view of the hotel pool and the waters. The low tide in the morning isn‚Äôt the best view but by the afternoon the view gets great with the rising tide. They have a pool bar and the pool is nice and long so you can get a couple of laps in to get your heart pumping or just enjoy some time to yourself in the pool. The water is at a good temperature where it‚Äôs still refreshing to get in but not too cold where it‚Äôs uncomfortable. They do have a kids pool which is shallow but something that the kids can enjoy. The spa was also very nice, they have a very wide menu, and the schedule availability was very good when I visited, they were usually ready within the hour and were always available when scheduled in advance. Yes, it is a bit more expensive than options outside the hotel, but the quality and convenience is what you are paying a bit more on, so for me it was a win. The rooftop bar is also very nice and well designed. I did not get the chance to enjoy a drink at the time, but definitely a great place with a great view and friendly staff that greeted me. Will be taking advantage of this place next time around. The daily breakfast is also very much worth it so add it to your stay if you are able to. They have one of the best hotel breakfasts I‚Äôve had the pleasure of enjoying. It served the typical fair that you would expect from a hotel, with minor rotations to ensure you dont‚Äô get bored of the food, but at the same time get to enjoy some of your favorites again. I particularly enjoyed their drink cart which had numerous types of ginger drinks, from ginger and honey, ginger and turmeric, and more! They even had a kopi stand as well! Aside from the drinks they can cut fresh local fruit for you. I got to enjoy plenty of mangosteen (manggis) which were very much in season! They had a custom noodle station and an omelet station with local specials such as the seafood omelet which was unique and so good for what I was looking for! And on our last day the staff surprised us with a nice corner table well decorated with rose petals. It was incredible. They even made us some custom drinks which were very tasty it was some sort of guava, strawberry, with soda. It was so good! Everyone was amazing at this hotel. I already am looking forward to my already booked stay a few weeks from now to experience it all over again! Thank you again to Rena, Vivi, Sandi, Mez, Vinsen, Jennifer and the many staff at Batam Marriott!

We went Batam from 6 to 7 June . As the hotel is just beside Harbour Bay Ferry terminal, we dropped by for lunch. Hotel is very posh. Staffs very polite and helpful. Thanks once again!

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Batam Marriott Harbour Bay and I must say it was an exceptional experience from start to finish. The ocean view room has breathtaking views and the cleanliness of the hotel is superb. The breakfast spread is a must to take - halal, delicious and spoiled for choice.
Good hospitality, bersih dan nyaman, lokasi strategis

This hotel plus the people are awesome! Very accommodating and they have commendable attitude towards guests. You'll never feel different treatment from them for all guests. Spent two nights here during my last visit to Batam. No complaints on the room, services and location, everything's just perfect. Located just above the Harbour Bay ferry terminal, you can say it‚Äôs a good location or not so good if you wish to be near city centre. So location is very subjective. Great hotel, rooftop bar has great atmosphere. Friendly bartenders, especially Jey and Reno. music is great and drinks are reasonably priced. will be back.

Cool bar (Altitude) on the top floor overlooking the harbour. Great service from the bar staff, in particular Jey, who was very helpful with good knowledge of the hotel and also local area. Highly recommend for a few beers after work.

All the staff we interacted with from the breakfast kitchen to the housekeeping and reception, were super-friendly and looked happy to be working here. This is the best stay ever I had in Batam! I contemplated on my (last minute) booking due to the price per night but I didn't regret it. Staffs are very helpful and welcoming upon my arrival. Only thing you need to remember is the tap water is NOT PORTABLE. Cannot even boil the tap water to cook anything. Never used their spa coz much cheaper spa is everywhere in Batam. Location is super convenient. Just turn left and walk straight from ferry exit and the hotel is there. Definitely will stay again and again

I am very happy to stay in this hotel as the concierge provides great service ,specifically Mass Mezz Riyal and the team. But it was the personable and indefatigable staff that were the stars. Everyone smiles and serves with unbridled Javanese warmth. Yes, everyone, everywhere and every day.

Our Check-in at JW Marriot took more than 10mins. With 2 staff at concierge but attending to others when we were asked to wait without further explanation. Could have handled it better. Unpleasant experience from the start as there wasn't any bell boy at the hotel entrance to welcome, in fact throughout our entire stay there too. Got to take a set from the balcony into the room for checking emails on laptop, and other purposes like makeup and meals. My room's curtain couldn't close properly, leaving a 6 to 7 inch gap. Every morning was awoken by the early sunrise at 6am. Didn't expect this from a 5 stars hotel. On 2 of my morning sleep, my family and I were also disturbed by prayers and songs from a mosque nearby at 4plus am which was really loud on the first night. My youngest son was asking them to stop in his sleep! Had asked for sea view but was given a garden view which was made up with a room change quite promptly. However, a key card was working after the change and another key card that expired in 24hrs when we were staying for 3 nights. 1 of the light in the room wasn't working, making the dimly lighted room darker. 1 of the light in the gym female toilet wasn't working too when I tried to makeup there. Went to the gym to make up instead! On 2nd night of my stay, a staff pressed the doorbell at about 9am to enquire if room service was required when makeup room button is available at the doorstep. We have yet to ask for it as we were still sleeping. He made up for it by apologising. On the 3rd night of our stay, which is a X'mas Day, we received a call at 6.20am but the call was dropped as I was still drowsy from my sleep. Received another call at 6.45am to say about my family was not having breakfast or breakfast department said to call about breakfast. The best part is I couldn't understand what she wanted at all. My entire family was still sleeping from the late night dinner and party on X'mas' Eve. Finally, she got it that I was pissed by the early phone call. She ended the call by saying Thank You instead of Sorry!!!! Speechless for a moment. My sleep was disturbed and I was upset thereafter that I couldn't sleep anymore. The Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay is a modern and luxurious hotel located in the heart of Batam, Indonesia. The hotel's location is ideal, situated just a short distance from the ferry terminal and within easy reach of the city's top attractions. Upon arrival, I was impressed by the hotel's contemporary design and elegant decor. The lobby area was spacious and welcoming, with friendly and attentive staff ready to assist with any requests. The rooms at the Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay were spacious, comfortable, and well-appointed, with modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs, air conditioning, and free Wi-Fi. The room I stayed in had a large comfortable bed and a beautiful view of the sea, which was a great spot to relax and take in the view. The hotel also boasts a range of facilities, including a fitness center, a swimming pool, and a spa, which I thoroughly enjoyed during my stay. The pool area was particularly impressive, offering a relaxing environment to soak up the Indonesian sun. The food options at the Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay were also excellent, with a range of restaurants and bars to choose from. The breakfast buffet was varied and tasty, with a selection of hot and cold dishes to suit all tastes. The hotel's Indonesian restaurant, Wan Li, also provided an excellent dining experience with delicious local cuisine. Overall, I would highly recommend the Batam Marriott Hotel Harbour Bay for anyone visiting Batam. The hotel's location, facilities, and attentive staff make for an enjoyable and memorable stay.

Impeccable level of service , the service staff were always around and willing to help. Great view from the room , gym was small but modern. Only grievance was the plumbing, the water temperature from the shower was going hot and cold throughoutüôÑ You guys really need to fix this ‚Ä¶

Visit here for a date and we were looking for a live music with a cool place. And we found this Mill&Co inside this hotel. Love the ambiemce and service! We love the jazz band, and myself love their gin and tonic. For the pastry was not up to my liking. We tried pistachio something for the pastry. Looking forward coming back here and get a room for my next visit from Jakarta!

Located just at/next to Harbour Bay, upon disembarking from the ferry, you are literally a stone's throw away. Hotel is located within the harbour bayfront area and connected to a modest mall with food court, kfc, Starbucks. We came at a rather off-peak timing. Pengalaman yang sangat menyenangkan bagi saya dapat menginap di hotel bintang 5 di kawasan Harbour Bay Batam. Saya menginap di kamar Deluxe King selama 2 malam. Suasana kamar yang nyaman dan tenang membuat betah tidur nyenyak. Tertidur di sofa pun sangat nyenyak. Goji restaurant menyajikan breakfast yang enak, bergizi, dan pilihan menu sangat lengkap. How can this be a 5 star hotel? Overpriced as well. No dressing table, poor room design, seaview blocked by plants and trees. $22sgd breakfast buffet is so average. Poor receptionist service. The bed is hard and uncomfortable. Noisy surroundings as well.....

The room is spacious and clean. Love the couch that takes up the entire window side of the room, which makes it really nice to chill. Linen and towels are so soft. The basic amenities are great too. The entire experience (with Altitude rooftop bar) really elevated my Batam experience.

Marriott Batam is a destination in itself (Batam doesn't have much to do anyway besides eating shopping and massage).i have been a Bonvoy elite member for years,and one of the key things i look for in an excellent hotel is whether every staff greets you,and also the attention to detail. I was really really impressed by the friendliness and service mindedness of every single staff who stopped and greeted us,even right down to the technician! A special shoutout too to the front desk manager Tintin, who really displayed exemplary service recovery after an episode on the first night(they reassigned us to the suite!). She made sure to personally find us and apologise while we were having breakfast at Goji,and even invited us to the iftar evening buffet; the breakfast and dinner buffet is AMAZING!(its the only Marriott i've stayed that has a very wide food variety and very well prepared). The level 5 pool facing suite room too in particular,we absolutely loved the spacious layout,many recliner chairs and very comfy bed. The level 11 lounge too has a great view of the sea and has outdoor seating. Also the hotel is conveniently located just 2mins walk from the harborfront ferry terminal and is just a 10min drive to nearby shopping malls,so it takes the stress out of having to plan to depart early to catch the ferry (we left hotel only 15mins prior to departure). All in all, i would say its the most value for money Marriott stay i've ever had. For SGD $250 a night,you'll be hard pressed to even find any hotel in Singapore that comes close to the excellent level of service and amenities that Marriott Batam Harborbay has to offer. 10/10 would definitely return again!

Special thanks to Mr Rahmat Yusri (Guest Experience Specialist) - he made my stay with my family such a wonderful and memorable one. Everything was well-taken care of, and he made great efforts to ensure we enjoyed our stay. Also, a big thank you to Mr Mez, Mr Faridz and Mr Dedy. I ought to say we went over the long weekend, when they were supposed to be more busy and therefore maybe ought to cut them some slack. That said, the entire stay was just a series of disappointments and frustrations, and our Marriott stay turned out to be the worst part of our entire trip. When booking, and again a couple of days before check-in, I requested connecting rooms because I was travelling with 2 young children and a senior, and needed to take care of them. My requests were acknowledged. We arrived at about 10:45am, and there were no connecting rooms available. I said I could wait until dinner time, when hopefully some guests have checked out, availing of connecting rooms. The staff member said that could help, and she would try to get us the rooms then. However, when we got back to the hotel after 8pm and asked for our connecting rooms, we were told that there was no such request logged. We were given rooms on the same level to make it easy for me to care for my family. They were on separate ends of the corridor! In the room, we also realised that cleanliness wasn't great. The kids asked why the pillows were so stinky. We asked housekeeping for body lotion, and were told that the hotel had run out of those. Sound-proofing wasn't great either. We were kept awake by loud music from outside until late. We also knew a few neighbours had the habit of returning to their rooms past midnight, and even where exactly they were partying. At breakfast, half the food offerings were out at any point of time, and the coffee machine was down most of the time. Orders were repeatedly forgotten, and nobody came to remove plates. We were told that they did not have children's cutlery in this hotel - never heard such a thing anywhere else in the world. Spa session for the wife and mother - booked it for 4.30pm, but at 4.15pm , we received a call asking if we could postpone to 5pm instead. We informed the caller that we had a dinner reservation, and had to stick with the timing. She agreed. In the end, the wife and mother were kept waiting for 45 minutes. The wife told them that we would miss our dinner appointment, and had to cancel the session. The staff members insisted if they were to cancel the session, we would still have to pay the full price as a cancellation penalty, even though it was the staff's fault for being 45 minutes late! So we ended up with a spa session that was 45 minutes late, a missed dinner reservation, a couple of kids who were hungry and cranky and had to be distracted with snacks while waiting, resulting in more frustrations at dinner because they no longer had an appetite and were just too drowsy because it was almost bedtime. Elite members were offered cocktail vouchers at the rooftop bar. While the disastrous spa session was taking place, I brought the kids to the bar to utilise the vouchers. Unfortunately children were not allowed at the rooftop bar. I was then advised to go to the lobby lounge instead, where I was assured they would also honour the vouchers. At the lobby lounge, I was told the vouchers were only valid at the rooftop bar. I told them I was turned away and referred to the lobby lounge, the gentleman at the lobby lounge insisted he would not accept the vouchers. He then told me I could leave my 7yo and 4yo alone in the room, and go by myself to the rooftop bar to sip cocktails. The last morning, brought the kids to the pool, and they had run out of towels. I had to grab a small towels from the gym. There was also mold/algae at the children's pool entrance, which got several kids (including mine) landing on their butts. At 10am I also requested for a late check-out because my ferry was only leaving at 2:30pm. I was told I could stay in one of our rooms until 1.30pm. At 12:30pm however, we received a call to the room asking us why we had not vacated that room. At this price point, I know of many other Marriott properties in Bali and other parts of ASEAN which can offer much better value.

Many a time, they were able to fulfill our many questions and requests for them, and provide us ideal comfort as their guests. Food options are also vast, with the Boat equivalent just within walking distance of the hotel, in the direction of Harbour Bay Seafood restaurant (there's a few others in that direction). If not, the hotel's dining options are more than sufficient. Altitude bar, Goji Kitchen and Bar, The Lounge, Jiang He Chinese cuisine. Can't complain really.
